page.title: 16Rail Transport
page.content: The railway was built by the Midland Railway Company between 1850 _ 1860. The line is the main route from Lincoln to Nottingham and carries both passengers and freight.A High Speed Train unit uses the line being the service from Cleethorpes to London Kings Cross.It does not stop at Swinderby.There are twelve stopping trains a day at the now unmanned station.The trains are made up of D.M.U. and locomotive hauled(Type 31) mark 1 rolling stock.The signal box controls the sections of track between Cottage Lane,Collingham to the west and Thorpe_On_The_Hill to the East.The level crossing is still manually operated.The main freight on the line is made up of oil tankers and there are ten trains daily in each direction.
